dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3391 RH: Gabriella Miller Kids First Research Act 2.0
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Wexton (for herself, Mr. Cole, Mr. Bilirakis, Mrs. Dingell, Ms. Stansbury, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Kilmer, Ms. Chu, Mr. Tonko, Ms. Castor of Florida, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Ms. Strickland, Ms. Wild, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Quigley, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Pingree, Mr. Kim of New Jersey, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Posey, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Bost, Mr. Rutherford, and Ms. McClellan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Mr. Fitzpatrick, Ms. Porter, Mr. Crow, Ms. Salazar, Mr. LaTurner, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Moskowitz, Mr. Correa, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Mr. Neguse, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Mann, and Mr. Mooney
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 16, 2023

form.official-title: To extend the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Program at the National Institutes of Health, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Gabriella Miller Kids First Research Act 2.0.

section.header: Funding for the Pediatric Research Initiative
section.text: The Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 201 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking to the Common Fund and inserting to the Division of Program Coordination, Planning, and Strategic Initiatives;
by striking and reserved under subsection (c)(1)(B)(i) of this section; and
by striking 2014 through 2023 and inserting 2024 through 2028;

paragraph.text: in each of paragraphs (1)(A) and (2)(C) of section 402A(c) (42 U.S.C. 282a(c)), by striking section 402(b)(7)(B) and inserting section 402(b)(7)(B)(i); and
in section 402(b)(7)(B)(ii) (42 U.S.C. 282(b)(7)(B)(ii)), by striking the Common Fund and inserting the Division of Program Coordination, Planning, and Strategic Initiatives.

section.header: Coordination of NIH funding for pediatric research

subsection.text: It is the sense of the Congress that the Director of the National Institutes of Health should continue to oversee and coordinate research that is conducted or supported by the National Institutes of Health for research on pediatric cancer and other pediatric diseases and conditions, including through the Pediatric Research Initiative Fund.

Section 402(b)(7)(B)(ii) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 282(b)(7)(B)(ii)) is amended by inserting and shall prioritize, as appropriate, such pediatric research that does not duplicate existing research activities of the National Institutes of Health before ; and.

section.header: Report on progress and investments in pediatric research
section.text: Not later than 5 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall submit to the Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions of the Senate a report that—

paragraph.text: details pediatric research projects and initiatives receiving funds allocated pursuant to section 402(b)(7)(B)(ii) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 282(b)(7)(B)(ii)); and
summarizes advancements made in pediatric research with funds allocated pursuant to such section.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
